mods.abstract: Page 4 of the album includes three photographs.; Photograph 1 [180] shows tagged pigs at an exhibition surrounded by judges with clipboards at the Louisiana State Fair in Shreveport. Racetrack and grandstand shown in the background.; Photograph 2 [181] shows three boys from Scott, LA, at the State Fair with one of their pigs, which won the sweepstakes at the Lafayette Fair.; Photograph 3 [182] shows a boy in a suit and flat cap standing behind his pig. A silo and farm buildings shown in the background.
mods.note: Photograph 2 was published in the following journal. Balis, W.H. (1914, March) Pig Clubs in Louisiana. University Bulletin, Vol. 5, N.S. (No. 3), p.12. Photograph is captioned, "Boys from Scott, La., at the State Fair with one of their pigs which won sweepstakes at the Lafayette Fair." Retrieved August 4, 2014, from https://archive.org/stream/pigclubsinlouisi00loui#page/1/mode/2up; One of the boys in Photograph 2 is probably George Sonnier, from Scott, La., who had a championship sow in 1914. A Typical Pig Club Boy. (1914, October 17) The true democrat, Vol.23 (No. 38), p. 1. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88064339/1914-10-17/ed-1/seq-1/; Photograph 3 is also found on Page 65, image 193.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
